body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL
Office Kentucky State Agency,
411 PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE,
Washington, D. C., Oct 13 1865.
Sir

On the 22 Sept I addressed a communication to the Secretary of the Treasury thro' the Office of the Third Auditor asking for a further advance on the War claim of the State of Ky filed prior to May 13 1863.
By direction of the Q. M. Genl of Ky I Stated the account thus:

row.cell: Balance claimed by State of Ky

body.p: This Statement assumes that the direct tax forms a part of the Sum advanced viz $1.051.000.00 but upon investigation I find that there has been $1.051.000.00 advanced in cash as follows.

This sum does not include the direct tax which
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL
Office Kentucky State Agency,
411 PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE,
Washinton, D. C.,
is $606.641.04 instead of $615.000.00 as assumed in my letter above referred to.

I made my Statement upon information derived from yourself and Genl Suddarth. The mistake is a large one. The whole amt advanced to the State including the direct tax is $1.657.641.04 which deducted from the Amt claimed by the State viz $2.246.400.73 leaves a balance of only $588.759.69. The balance is too small to insure a hope that any further advance will be made.

You will please examine the auditors books & report whether his accounts agree with this. The dates of his entries may differ from the dates here given as there is sometimes quite a delay between the date of a requisition for funds and the date of its transmission to the party asking for it. The first two sums viz $315000 and $436.000 were received by Joshua F. Speed as agent for the State. The Sum of $100.000 was transmitted to Gov Robinson in Aug 1863 and the sum of $200.000 transmitted to you in March 1864

I respectfully request that you inform me on this subject. The State account will be
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL
Office Kentucky State Agency,
411 PENNSYLVANIA AVENUE,
Washinton, D. C.,
taken up for examination in a few days, and it is important that I should have a correct account.

I am Sir
Very Respectfully
Your obt Servant
C D Pennebaker
Agent State Kentucky.

His Excellency
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Ky.
Frankfort Ky
L B Vol 8. 960
